page.title: 08Politics in Priors Marston
page.content: Priors Marston is mainly{Conservative, and returns Conservative candidates at national, county and district levels. The{Parish Council}is a strictly non-political body - all candidates putting up as independents. At the 1980{District Council} election with Conservative, Labour & Liberal candidates there was a 58% turnout in the Napton Priors ward (i.e. Priors Marston, Priors Hardwick, Napton & Shuckborough). At the 1984{District Council election, with Conservative & Labour candidates (both Priors Marston women) out of an electorate of 360 in Priors Marston 180 people voted. The turnout in the ward as a whole was 48%. The{Conservative Association}is possibly the most active political organisation, holding regular meetings and fund raising events.
